reviewText: .38 Special live is basically the same concert as the Sturgis DVD, with less songs as the Sturgis DVD. Thought the Live dvd has maybe some diffrent camera angle's, still fun to watch. Sound is pretty tight. If you want to collect every DVD of .38, then add this one to your collection. If you want to hear more songs, then get Sturgis .38 Special DVD. Both Kick a#@

reviewText: While I actually bought this concert when it came out on VHS, I bought it again on cd, I love it. If U like 38 Special there is nothing not to like about it. Danny Chaucey is a very good guitar player, very underrated. The band is tight, the songs are a good selection. I saw them about 3 yrs ago live and they put on a very audience friendly show, always talking to their fans & no vulgar language.

reviewText: I hard already purchased this package in the form of the Sturgis concert and did not realize they had cut out some of the material from that show.  If you do not have any 38 Special concert DVD's this is a good DVD for you, if you do have others shows, buyer beware...pay attention to the detail on the package.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a very good concert dvd of 38 Special performing at the Sturgis, SD Harley Daivdson festival. The music is great, the band is great, the atmosphere is great. It's a fun and enjoyable concert dvd to watch.The line-up consists of Don Barnes on lead vocals and guitar, Donnie Van Zant on lead vocals and guitar, Donny Chauncey on guitar, Larry Junstrom on bass guitar, Bobby Capps on keyboards, and Gary Moffatt on Drums.The concert consists of 10 songs. They are as follows:"Hold on Loosley", "Caught up in YOu", "Rockin' into the Night", "If I'd been the One", "Twentieth Century Fox", "Back where we Belong", "Wild-eyed Southern Boys", "Fantasy Girl, "Take' em Out", and "DeJa VooDoo".Overall, it's a very good 4 star quality concert dvd. It is enjoyable and entertaining, and the band really does rock!

reviewText: I think 38 special is incredible this concert is amazing I can't stop watching it.my only wish is that they would put it on blu ray other than that it is one of the best concerts I own!!

reviewText: What type of venue could be any better to catch a .38 Special concert than a biker rally? Thanks to Sony/BMG Music Entertainment for this (2007) DVD release of the 1999 live concert from the Buffalo Chip Campgrounds in Sturgis SD. The Southern Boys of rock were in fine form for their 1999 gig in Sturgis and they definitely rocked to an enthusiastic crowd. This concert DVD captures the band performing 10 songs from the show in front of several thousand revved up and raucous Harley faithful at the annual biker festival. The video transfer of this concert is great as the performance was captured by 10 different cameras to give us the best live show possible. My only complaint is that the Dolby Digital 5.1 audio is a little muddled and weak at times throughout the show. The PCM Stereo mix sounds much fuller and clearer than the 5.1, so it's a nice option to have.Do yourself a favor and Pour some Jack Daniels or Grab a cold one and rev up your engine as .38 Special rumbles through some of their biggest hits like "Rockin' into the Night," "Wild-Eyed Southern Boys," "Hold on Loosely," "Fantasy Girl", "Caught up in You" and others. The band played with great precision and their performance was energetic to say the least. Don Barnes vocal range is still amazing and Donnie Van Zant is still a showman on stage. After all these years the music is still great and this 1999 concert proves that "The Good Old Southern Boys of Rock" still know how to lay it down.The Band:Don Barnes: Lead Vocals & GuitarDonnie Van Zant: Vocals & GuitarDonny Chauncey: Guitar & VocalsLarry (L J) Junstrom: BassBobby Capps: Keyboards & VocalsGary Moffat: DrumsThe Songs:Hold on LooselyDeja VoodooRockin' into the NightIf I'd been the OneTwentieth Century FoxBack where you BelongWild-Eyed Southern BoysFantasy GirlTake`Em OutCaught up in You

reviewText: If this show is the one from 1999 at the Sturgis bike rally, doi yourself a favor and get "Live at Sturgis" which features the medley and what looks like a much more complete show. These guys are too good in concert to just present part of their live show!
summary: There's a more complete concert from these guys...
